intro: Icica acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed icica, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes a wide variety of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
